newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-JOCKEY CARSON SAID TO BE QUITTING.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-JOCKEY CARSON SAID TO BE QUITTING.

text.p: Willie Carson, badly injured in a racecourse paddock accident last September, has told a tabloid newspaper his riding days are over.
"Now I am an ex-jockey. I just can't push this old body any more," the 54-year-old former champion was quoted telling Sunday's News of the World.

Carson, who has ridden four Epsom Derby winners, said: "I have ripped something in my back and it is giving me trouble. I had it last year before the accident and now it is back. It was the signal for me to quit."
The ebullient Scotsman, whose liver was split when a horse lashed out at him, has ridden more than 3,500 winners and been champion jockey five times.
He has ridden 14 English classic winners including an effortless Epsom Derby triumph on Troy in 1979.
